Randomizer Settings: Shuffle job skills
Shuffles skills among jobs.
Separately shuffle base and advanced jobs
This shuffles the Armsmaster, Arcanist, Conjurer, and Inventor job skills separately from the 8 main jobs.
Separately shuffle divine skills
This ensures each job will only get one Divine Skill.
Separately shuffle Ex Abilities
This ensures each job will get two Ex Abilities, and they will remain in the Ex Ability slots.
Shuffle weapons used by physical attack skills
Change weapons used by physical attacks, e.g. HP Thief could become a Staff attack rather than a Dagger attack.
Shuffle weapons PCs/jobs can equip

Change weapons used by PCs and jobs, e.g. Clerics could equip a Sword and Dagger rather than a Staff. Minor changes are made to some early game enemy shields to ensure they can still be broken.

NB: Jobs don't have animations for all weapons, so expect these to be messed up. Optimizing weapons in settings is often wrong, selecting makeshift weapons.
Random JP costs
Randomly adjusts JP costs to learn job skills. Costs will always increase with each skill learned.

Nerf JP costs of advanced jobs: Changes JP costs of learning abilities in advanced jobs to those of base jobs.
Randomly adjusts SP costs of job skills by up to 30%.
Randomly adjusts power of all skills by up to 30%.
Keep Evasive Maneuvers in first slot
This ensures that Evasive Maneuvers will end up on a base job and in the first slot. It can be learned after earning just 1 JP.
Separately shuffle base and advanced jobs
This ensures each job will only get one Divine Skill.
Shuffles each PC base stat and each job bonus stat.

Randomizer Settings: Shuffle leaves from Collect
Shuffles leaves taken from enemies using the "Collect" command. Boss leaves are shuffled separately.
Shuffle stealable items
Shuffles stealable items from enemies. Boss items are shuffled separately.
Shuffle dropped items
Shuffles items dropped by enemies. Boss items are shuffled separately.
Randomize enemy shields
Randomize shield weaknesses of most random encounter enemies and main story bosses. Note that some bosses are incompatible with this and hence omitted, and optional bosses have not yet been included.
Shuffle random encounter groupings
Shuffles enemy groupings in random encounters. Bosses, (most) events, and NPCs are omitted.
Shuffle bosses

Bosses are shuffled separately in groups of early game, mid game, and late game bosses:

Early game: first chapter bosses

Mid game: bosses between first and final chapters

Late game: final chapter bosses plus Creeping Shadow, Arcanette, and the Grotesque Monster
Omit early bosses
Don't shuffle early bosses.
Shuffle mid & late game bosses together
Shuffles mid game and late game bosses together, rather than separately.
Include mid game optional bosses

Includes the following optional bosses as mid game bosses: Audnvarg, Battle-Worn Shark, Carnivorous Plant, Delsta Devil, Devourer of Dreams, Gigantes, Gken, Ichchadhari the Snake Charmer, Lord of the Sands, Manymaws, Monarch, Ruffian Leader, Scourge of the Sea, and Tyran the Seeker.
Include late game optional bosses
Includes the following optional bosses as late game bosses: Behemoth, Deep One, Dreadwolf, Heavenwing, Priestess Hinoekagura, and Tyrannodrake.
Include Vide the Wicked

Includes Vide the Wicked as a late game boss.

Vide causes softlocks and is omitted.
Include Galdera
Includes both of Galdera's phases as late game bosses.

Shuffle Bribed Leaves: Shuffles leaves that can be bribed from enemies. Boss bribes are shuffled separately.

Randomizer Settings: Shuffle items
Shuffle chest items, hidden items, and items from NPCs. By default, all Knowledge and Valuable items are kept in their original spots.
Include rusty weapons

Include rusty weapons in the item shuffle, including the Rusty Sword reward from the sidequest.

This option will be ignored if the Events & Key Items options Guilds and/or Spawn Guilds are on as they affect the logic.
Include parts for the Inventor

Include valuable items needed by the inventor: Rainbow Glass Bottle, Mythical Horn, Tin Toy, Scrap Metal, Ancient Cog, and Natural Magnetite.

This option will be ignored if the Events & Key Items options Guilds and/or Spawn Guilds are on as they affect the logic.
Include job licenses
Include job licenses in the item shuffle.
Shuffle items from captures
Shuffles jerky, etc. collected when processing captured species.
Shuffle license requirements
Shuffle requirements for gaining a second or third license, e.g. Hunter licenses could have the Merchant's 100,000 and 300,000 leaves requirements.

Events & Key Items: Unlocking main story chapters, the Scent of Commerce, Crossed Paths, and extinguished Sacred Flames will be included in your item pool. Finishing each of these may give you new items from your item pool.
Completing sidequests The Traveler's Bag, Producuring Peculiar Tomes, From the Far Reaches of Hell, and A Gate Between Worlds may give you new items from your item pool.
PCs will be included in the item pool. They will no longer be recruitable in their original locations.
Guild masters may give you an item from your item pool in addition to the license.

Include EX Skills from altars and finishing final chapters in your item pool. You can also find shuffled items at altars and by finishing final chapters. (Osvald and Agnea will still learn their second skills in their final battles, but you may still stumble upon them elsewhere.)
Passing the guard will be included in your item pool. The guard will be made unbeatable.
Foreign Assassins in Hired Help will be included in your item pool. Beating the assassins will unlock a random item from your item pool.

Spawns: New events spawning boat NPCs at the anchorages will be included in your item pool. (The Grand Terry is omitted in this option. It is included in the main story option.)
New events that spawn guild masters will be included in your item pool.
New events that spawn altars will be included in your item pool. (Altars will still be visible, they just won't do anything until you unlock them with the appropriate new item.)
A new event that spawns the assassins will be included in your item pool.

PCs: Pick a PC to start with. Only one PC will be guaranteed to be beatable.
Pick the number of PCs to start with. Any PC other than the first will be recruited right after completing Chapter 1 of your main protagonist.

Path Actions: Agnea can Allure NPCs with a 100% success rate.
Throne can ambush NPCs at any level.
Ochette can befriend NPCs with just a Healing Grape.
Hikari can Bribe information for just 1 leaf.
Hikari can Challenge NPCs at any level.
Agnea can perform Entreat at any level.
Temenos can guide NPCs at any level.
Partitio can hire NPCs for just 1 leaf.
Castti can Inquire information at any level.
Partitio can purchase items from NPCs for 1 leaf.
Osvald can Scrutinize with a 100% success rate.
Castti can soothe NPCs with just a Healing Grape.
Throne can steal items from NPCs with a 100% success rate.
Scales experience gained from each enemy in battle.
Scales JP gained from each enemy in battle.
Scales leaves gained from each enemy in battle.
Enemies always drop items after battle.
Pick a character who starts with a Spurning Ribbon equipped.

The Formation menu in the main menu will be always be available.

NB: This works by modifying flags at the start of a new game. It will not work on prior saves.
The protagonist will be unlocked and can be removed from your party before completing their story.
